channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uninsured car, 25th February
item.description:
This car along with 3 others are uninsured and dumped!!! These have been reported many times. Please remove!!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enlarging pothole and road debris opposite Cascades NW3 7AJ, 25th February
item.description:
This pothole has developed rapidly because of the heavy traffic along Finchley Road, throwing up debris and affecting the safety of motorists and pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finchley Road, Golders Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every week abandoned shopping trolleys meet!, 25th February
item.description:
Every week I am reporting abandoned shopping trolleys on Kangley bridge road pavement alongside Screwfix. Please can they be removed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kangley Bridge Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 15 Mill Lane, 25th February
item.description:
Some lower branches of the street tree are overhanging the pavement and the entrance to the building. The branches are also partially obstructing the view of the pedestrian light at the nearby zebra crossing. The tree is close to the building, and in the past there were minor root issues with plumbing that have now been resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Kilburn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garbage bins, illegal restaurant waste, 25th February
item.description:
For months, local restaurants and food trucks have been dumping their waste in our garbage bins. This weekend, we obtained a video showing who is responsible, including clear footage of faces and license plate numbers, and we have submitted it to the police. It appears they filled all of our bins with oil cans and rotting meat. Could we please request that this be picked up as soon as possible? There are rats all around the bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole where bridge tarmac and road tarmac meet., 25th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
